passage:
(1) Energy is a crucial resource that powers our daily lives in countless ways. There are several different types of energy, each with its own unique characteristics and applications. Energy can be broadly classified into renewable and non-renewable sources, depending on whether they can be naturally replenished within a human lifetime. Understanding these different forms of energy and their uses is partial to making informed decisions about our energy consumption and its impact on the environment.

(2) Non-renewable energy sources include fossil fuels such as coal, oil, and natural gas. These resources formed over millions of years from the remains of plants and animals and cannot be replaced once they are used up. Fossil fuels currently provide about 80% of the world's energy needs. They are burned to generate electricity, power vehicles, and heat buildings. Nuclear energy is another non-renewable source that produces electricity through nuclear fission, where atoms are split to release energy with minimal greenhouse gas emissions.

(3) Renewable energy comes from natural sources that replenish themselves over short periods. Solar energy harnesses the power of sunlight using panels that convert it into electricity or heat. Wind energy captures the kinetic energy of moving air through turbines. Hydroelectric power generates electricity by using the force of flowing water. Geothermal energy taps into the internal heat of the Earth, while biomass energy comes from burning organic materials like wood, crops, and waste. These clean energy sources produce little to no pollution and help reduce our dependence on fossil fuels.

(4) Energy storage and distribution are important aspects of our energy systems. Batteries store energy for later use, while power grids distribute electricity across vast distances to homes and businesses. As technology advances, we continue to develop more efficient ways to store and transmit energy. Smart grids, for instance, use digital technology to monitor and manage electricity flow, improving reliability and reducing waste. Meanwhile, researchers are working to improve battery technology to store renewable energy more effectively.

(5) The future of energy will likely involve a mix of different sources, with renewable energy playing an increasingly important role. Many countries have set ambitious targets to increase their use of renewable energy and reduce carbon emissions. Individuals can also make a difference by choosing energy-efficient appliances, improving home insulation, or even installing solar panels. As we move forward, the transition to cleaner energy sources will be essential for addressing climate change and creating a sustainable energy future for generations to come.

questions.question: Which verb form correctly completes the sentence? 'She _____ here since 2010.'
Choose the correct conditional form: 'If it _____ tomorrow, we will cancel the picnic.'
Select the correct past tense form: 'They _____ dinner when I arrived.'
Which sentence contains an error in subject-verb agreement?

options.A: The committee has made its decision.
options.B: My family are going on vacation next week.
options.C: Each of the students has completed the assignment.
options.D: The number of participants is increasing.

questions.question: Choose the correct relative pronoun: 'The woman _____ car was stolen called the police.'
Select the correct comparative form: 'This book is _____ than the one I read last week.'
Identify the correct passive voice: 'The cake _____ by my mother yesterday.'
Which sentence uses the present perfect correctly?

options.B: She has lived here since three years.
options.C: We have already finished our homework.
options.D: They have went to the museum.

questions.question: Choose the correct modal verb: 'You _____ brush your teeth twice a day.'
Select the correct preposition: 'She arrived _____ the airport an hour ago.'
Which sentence uses the future continuous correctly?

options.A: I will working at 8 PM tonight.
options.B: She will be study when you call.
options.C: They will be watching a movie at this time tomorrow.
options.D: He will been sleeping by then.

questions.question: Choose the correct article: 'I saw _____ one-eyed cat in our neighborhood.'
Select the correct form of reported speech: 'I am tired,' she said.
Which sentence contains a gerund?

options.A: She wants to swim in the lake.
options.B: They enjoyed swimming in the pool.
options.C: We will swim tomorrow if it's warm.

questions.question: Choose the correct conditional form: 'If I _____ you, I would accept the job offer.'
Select the correct phrasal verb: 'Please _____ your coat when you enter the house.'
Choose the appropriate expression for making a suggestion:

options.B: How about going to the cinema?

questions.question: Select the correct connector: 'He didn't study, _____ he failed the exam.'
Choose the correct word to complete this collocation: 'He _____ a mistake on his tax form.'
Select the correct question tag: 'You don't like coffee, _____?'
Choose the appropriate response to 'Thank you.'
Complete the idiom: 'It's not rocket _____.'
Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: 'I'm sorry, but I have to _____ your invitation.'
Select the correct preposition: 'She's been working _____ this project for weeks.'
Choose the correct quantifier: 'There isn't _____ sugar left in the bowl.'
What does 'partial' mean in this sentence? 'I only have a partial understanding of quantum physics.'
What does 'counsel' mean?
What does 'forward' mean in this context? 'Please forward this email to the entire team.'
What does 'suppose' mean in this sentence? 'I suppose we could meet at 6 instead of 5.'
What does 'include' mean?

options.A: to contain as part of something

questions.question: What does 'version' refer to?

options.B: a form of something that varies from other forms

questions.question: What does 'dispose' mean in this context? 'Please dispose of your trash properly.'
What does 'install' mean?

options.A: to place equipment in position and make it ready for use

questions.question: What does 'internal' mean?
What does 'distance' refer to?
What are 'remarks'?
What is a 'diamond'?
What is a 'soldier'?

options.A: a person who works in a hospital
options.C: a person who serves in an army
options.D: a person who teaches in a school

questions.question: What does 'passive' mean?
What does 'nowhere' mean?
According to the passage, how are energy sources broadly classified?
According to paragraph 2, what percentage of the world's energy needs currently come from fossil fuels?
Which of the following is NOT a renewable energy source mentioned in the passage?
What is the main advantage of renewable energy sources according to the passage?

options.B: They produce little to no pollution

questions.question: What does a smart grid do according to paragraph 4?

options.B: It stores energy for later use
options.C: It monitors and manages electricity flow
options.D: It captures the energy from wind

questions.question: The word 'harnesses' in paragraph 3 is closest in meaning to:
According to the passage, what formed fossil fuels?

options.C: The remains of plants and animals over millions of years
options.D: The internal heat of the Earth

questions.question: What does the passage suggest about the future of energy?

options.A: We will use only fossil fuels
options.B: Renewable energy will play an increasingly important role
options.C: Nuclear energy will be the main source

questions.question: According to the passage, which of the following can individuals do to contribute to a more sustainable energy future?

options.D: Move to areas with no energy consumption

questions.question: What is the main purpose of this passage?

options.A: To argue that renewable energy is better than non-renewable energy
options.B: To explain how electricity is generated
options.C: To describe different types of energy and their applications
options.D: To predict future energy consumption patterns
